title: Airtel Ghana Outdoors New Smartphone
text:
19 August 2015 17:23 CET Airtel Ghana Outdoors New Smartphone By Daily Guide 
Airtel Ghana, a telecommunication leader in innovative data products and services, has introduced Alcatel Pixi III Smartphone onto the Ghanaian mobile phone market to help everybody to gain access to the latest technology. 
The mobile phone, which has a four-inch screen, comes with the latest pre-installed mobile applications for subscribers to enjoy usage at an affordable price, with free SIM card, 1GB data monthly for a period of one-year. 
John Claude Domilongo Bope, Director of Data Business, said the introduction of Alcatel Pixi III phone was an insightful move by Airtel Ghana to ensure that all demographics enjoy the smartphone experience and make internet more accessible to the Ghanaian populace. 
According to him, the telecommunication company has introduced many innovative data services, adding that notable among the value-added services are browse chaw bundles and dual scratch card, which enables consumers to load voice and data. 
'Airtel Ghana's partnership with Facebook is making it easier for people to access basic internet services. Through Facebook's internet.org app, Airtel customers using mobile internet capable devices could access a set of free services in categories such as health, education, communication, jobs and local information,' he disclosed. 
He added that the company was driven by the vision of providing affordable and innovative mobile services to people across 20 countries within which it operates. 
By Ernest Kofi Adu, Kumasi
